headline: From $20K To $1M: The Nvidia Trade Jim Cramer Called Back In 2017
summary: CNBC host Jim Cramer has been a longtime supporter of Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), regularly praising Chief Executive Jensen Huang's leadership and urging investors to hold the stock even during volatile periods. CNBC anchor Jon Fortt shared data in a recent program showing that Nvidia shares are up 4,600% since Cramer first recommended it in June 2017. "Nvidia stock is now up more than 4,600% since then," Fortt said. "So if you had invested a little more than $20,000 that day, you’d have a million dol

headline: Tesla’s October Sales Were Awful. The Stock Is Rising.
summary: Investors knew the fourth quarter would be tough for electric vehicle makers like  Tesla  They might not have known how tough—or how Tesla stock would react.  In October, Tesla sales fell 23% year over year in four markets, North America, Europe, China, and South Korea, according to industry data tracked by  Wells Fargo  analyst Colin Langan.

headline: Elon Musk Says 'It's Time' To Put Dogecoin On The Moon But It Is Not DOGE That Surges
summary: Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk has sent the price of a Solana memecoin surging with an X post rekindling a 2021 Dogecoin promise. “It’s time,” Musk said on Nov. 3 on X, referring to a 2021 promise “to put a literal Dogecoin on the literal moon” with a SpaceX mission aptly named DOGE-1. While the post in previous years would have sent DOGE soaring, the memecoin failed to react. Instead, it fell by as much as 10%, from about $0.19 to $0.16, amid a broad market crash. headline: Robert Kiyosaki Says He's Never Been Fired Because He's 'An Entrepreneur, Not An Employee'

headline: Nasdaq Loses Early Gains
summary: The Nasdaq Composite’s early gain didn’t last long. The tech-heavy index was down 0.3% after opening higher. The S&P 500 was up just 0.1%. The Dow was up 400 points, or 0.8%. Riskier stocks were still rebounding, but some of the S&P and Nasdaq’s heaviest hitters were mixed.

content.title: Nasdaq Loses Early Gains

headline: Crypto exchange Coinbase to reincorporate in Texas, exit Delaware
summary: Texas is ‌establishing itself as the new darling of Corporate America by drawing companies with its favorable business environment, ‌friendlier tax rules, lighter regulatory requirements, and new legislation aimed at establishing specialized business courts.  Several companies with a valuation of over $1 billion have moved their legal home out of Delaware since last year, in what some have nicknamed "Dexit."

headline: Coinbase Joins Tesla In Dumping Delaware as Its Legal Home
summary: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase Global is following Tesla and other tech companies in leaving Delaware, saying it plans to reincorporate in Texas due to the Lone Star State’s more business-friendly legal climate.  Coinbase Chief Legal Officer Paul Grewal announced the move in an opinion piece in The Wall Street Journal this morning, complaining that Delaware’s courts had become “rife with unpredictable outcomes” for companies.  Delaware has long been the legal home of most big U.S. companies, but a corporate exodus gained steam after Elon Musk decided last year to reincorporate Tesla in Texas, upset about a court ruling against his multibillion-dollar 2018 pay package.

content.title: Coinbase Joins Tesla In Dumping Delaware as Its Legal Home
content.summary: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase Global is following Tesla and other tech companies in leaving Delaware, saying it plans to reincorporate in Texas due to the Lone Star State’s more business-friendly legal climate.  Coinbase Chief Legal Officer Paul Grewal announced the move in an opinion piece in The Wall Street Journal this morning, complaining that Delaware’s courts had become “rife with unpredictable outcomes” for companies.  Delaware has long been the legal home of most big U.S. companies, but a corporate exodus gained steam after Elon Musk decided last year to reincorporate Tesla in Texas, upset about a court ruling against his multibillion-dollar 2018 pay package.

headline: Tesla recalls nearly 13,000 Model Y, Model 3s for battery hardware defect
